str2: Wherefore, on which account, therefore. From dia and hos; through which thing, i.e. Consequently.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 1st Person Plural
str2: To be zealous, strive eagerly, desire very strongly.
I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
Acceptable, well-pleasing (especially to God), grateful. From eu and arestos; fully agreeable.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
And if, whether. From ei and te; if too.

word: we are here in this body
parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To be at home, live in a place. From a compound of en and demos; to be in one's own country, i.e. Home.
And if, whether. From ei and te; if too.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To go abroad, be absent. From a compound of ek and demos; to emigrate, i.e. vacate or quit.
